choices.text: There are N squares arranged in a row. The squares are numbered 1, 2, ..., N, from left to right. Snuke is painting each square in red, green or blue. According to his aesthetic sense, the following M conditions must all be satisfied. The i-th condition is:  - There are exactly x_i different colors among squares l_i, l_i + 1, ..., r_i. In how many ways can the squares be painted to satisfy all the conditions  Find the count modulo 10^9+7. -----Constraints-----  - 1   N   300  - 1   M   300  - 1   l_i   r_i   N  - 1   x_i   3
